results.title: In the shadow of Djebel Sindjar
results.brief_description: Since Kurdistan is divided between Turkey, Iraq, Syria, Iran and Russia, a variety of lifestyles is evident throughout the country. This film tells of life in a tiny Yazidi village - Jedalla - in Kurdistan and compares this with life in a nomad camp.

results.title: In the service of peace
results.brief_description: Considers the work of the United Naitons in preserving peace throughout the world. Looks at various trouble-spots where UN forces are involved, particularly Cyprus. Here troops are maintaining surface peace and quiet between the Greeks and Turks. Highlights the training and activities of the Swedish contingent.

results.title: In the service of Europe
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the Economic Council of Europe to every citizen of the 30 countries involved. It has stimulated and organised trade and promoted co-operation, through discussion, the interchange of ideas and assistance among the interdependent nations.

results.title: In the public interest
results.creator_credit: S M S Audiovisual, Victorian Film Corporation, Lindsay Parker and Colin Pym
results.brief_description: A film about the work of the Victorian Police and the various areas of involvement. Shown is the work of the Mounted Police in crowd control, the patrol cars, involvement in scenes of fires and burglaries, scientific investigation, the dog squad and boat patrol crews.

results.title: In the name of the father [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hell's Kitchen, Gabriel Byrne and Jim Sheridan
results.brief_description: Gerry Conlon, a petty crook in Belfast during the 1970’s, gets in trouble with the IRA. His father sends him to England where a twist of fate puts him in the wrong place at the wrong time when a pub in Guildford is bombed. Gerry and three of his friends, although innocent, are charged and convicted. Gerry’s father joins him in prison and despite years of a strained relationship, Gerry learns to regard his father’s gentle spirit as a strength. Enlisting the aid of a lawyer, Guiseppe Conlon is determined to prove his son’s innocence, and when he dies in prison, Gerry is determined to take up the cause. Evidence is discovered which implicates senior police officials in a massive cover-up, and the ‘Guildford Four’ are finally set free. Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite and Emma Thompson are brilliant in their roles.

results.title: In the name of the crow
results.creator_credit: Peter Kordyl, Mark Bin Bakar, Marion Benjamin, Robert Bropho, Heather Williams and Excalibur Nominees
results.brief_description: Most tourists who visit Rottnest Island are unaware of its history. Established as a prison for Aboriginal men around 1840, it was intended as a place for “rehabilitation”. However, accounts of floggings, chainings and hangings flourished on the mainland despite official enquiries and commissions suggesting everything was in order. In this documentary, Robert Bropho takes us to the island and traces the hardship and the suffering of his ancestors that has been omitted from white man’s history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Kordyl, Mark Bin Bakar, Marion Benjamin, Robert Bropho, Heather Williams and Excalibur Nominees

results.title: In the name of religion
results.creator_credit: James J. Cullen, J William Walker and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Minorities”.
Although religious freedom is guaranteed by the U.S. Constitution, prejudice against minority religious groups is a strong feature of American society. This film traces history of immigration and the growth of intolerance and persecution of religious minorities.

results.title: In the name of progress
results.creator_credit: Katherine Carpenter, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines well-intended development projects in the third world and the environmental disasters that resulted, and questions whether environmental protection and economic development are inherently in conflict. It profiles ‘sustainable development’ alternatives in Brazil and India. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
